alert.note: Alert for Clark; Scotland (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 8:37PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Clark and Scotland Counties through 930 PM CDT... At 835 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Memphis, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rainfall that can lead to minor flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor flooding. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Granger around 840 PM CDT. Rutledge and South Gorin around 845 PM CDT. Wyaconda around 850 PM CDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
